Global Risk-On / Risk-Off Positioning Tone

CoT market tone: risk-on vs risk-off positioning.

As of 2025-12-23

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The CoT Market Tone signal currently indicates a Strong Risk-Off regime as of 2025-12-23 (1).
  • This reflects a contraction in broad speculative risk appetite across futures markets. Conviction Band: High, Interpretation Confidence: High Confidence, Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The latest robust z-score of the net tone is -1.86 (1), well below the -1.0 threshold for Strong Risk-Off (1).
  • This is driven by crowded short positions (90 markets) significantly outnumbering crowded long positions (72 markets) (1).
  • The signal has shown a sharp shift from Neutral in early December to Strong Risk-Off by mid-December (1).
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse if the net tone z-score rises above -0.5, indicating a shift towards Neutral sentiment (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: Continued Strong Risk-Off sentiment, supported by the ongoing prevalence of speculative short crowding.
  • Upside secondary: A transition to Neutral or Risk-On, triggered by a broad reduction in crowded short positioning.
  • Downside residual: A deeper move into Strong Risk-Off, potentially signalling a more severe decline in speculative appetite.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months), reflecting the duration of broad speculative positioning trends.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: High, justified by strong conviction and high confidence in its systemic sentiment gauging ability.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Sentiment and broader risk appetite.
  • Cycle position: Suggests a late-cycle phase characterized by increased risk aversion.
  • Typical interaction: Often correlates with rising market volatility (2) and tightening credit conditions (3).

Data & References:

  • df_cot_tone_daily, latest observation 2025-12-23.
  • The `CoT_Market_Tone_z` and `CoT_Market_Tone_Regime` datapoints are most influential (1).
  • Additional public datasets: VIX futures positioning, implied volatility term structure.
